title: How to Make Stuffed Fish Fillets

steps.headline: In a dry skillet over medium low heat, toast pine nuts until brown.
steps.description: Shake the skillet frequently to avoid burning them. Set aside to cool.

steps.headline: Heat olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.
Add shallot and cook until soft which is about 3 minutes.
Add spinach, wine, salt and pepper and cook until spinach wilts, about 3 minutes.
Transfer to a cutting board, cool slightly, chop and place in a small bowl.
steps.description: Stir in pine nuts and set aside.

steps.headline: Heat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit (218 degrees Celsius).
Season fish fillets with pepper.
steps.description: (See Clean/Gut a Fish & Fillet a Fish}

steps.headline: Divide spinach mixture into four equal portions; place each in center of fish.
Roll the fillets, sprinkle with lemon juice and wrap each bundle with a slice of bacon.
Tuck a rosemary sprig beneath the bacon.
Place fish in baking dish and scatter sliced lemons around fish on the bottom of dish.
Bake for 12 to 15 minutes then transfer to the broiler and broil the top of the fish until lightly browned, about 2 minutes.

text: In a dry skillet over medium low heat, toast pine nuts until brown. Shake the skillet frequently to avoid burning them. Set aside to cool. Heat olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.  Add shallot and cook until soft which is about 3 minutes.  Add spinach, wine, salt and pepper and cook until spinach wilts, about 3 minutes.  Transfer to a cutting board, cool slightly, chop and place in a small bowl. Stir in pine nuts and set aside. Heat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit (218 degrees Celsius).  Season fish fillets with pepper. (See Clean/Gut a Fish & Fillet a Fish} Divide spinach mixture into four equal portions; place each in center of fish.  Roll the fillets, sprinkle with lemon juice and wrap each bundle with a slice of bacon.  Tuck a rosemary sprig beneath the bacon.  Place fish in baking dish and scatter sliced lemons around fish on the bottom of dish.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes then transfer to the broiler and broil the top of the fish until lightly browned, about 2 minutes.  Serve and enjoy!
